programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers beat Philadelphia in the NBA Finals in 1980, 1982 and 1983, while Boston won the crown by beating Houston in 1981; Los Angeles and Boston staged the first of three epic battles in 1984, and the rivalry transformed fans' view of the game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Utah State (24-4, 14-3) won its last five meetings with the Broncos after an 81-79 win on Jan. 11 behind 18 points from Ian Martinez; Boise State (19-8, 11-5) is 12-1 at home behind Tyson Degenhart, who is second in Mountain West scoring.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Defending champion Paris Saint-Germain, which leads all clubs with 15 titles since the tournament debuted in 1917, defeated Le Mans in the Round of 16, 2-0; Stade Briochin advanced with a 2-1 triumph over Nice at home on Feb. 5.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Georgetown (16-11, 7-9) is 3-7 on the road this season; UConn (18-9, 10-6) is 11-2 at home, and won its last nine meetings with the Hoyas after a 68-60 win on Jan. 11 behind 19 points from Alex Karaban and 15 points from Solo Ball.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova (16-12, 9-8) won four of its last six, and won nine of its last 10 meetings with the Pirates after a 79-67 win on Dec. 16 behind 25 points from Eric Dixon, who leads the country with 22.9 ppg; Seton Hall (7-20, 2-14) is 5-9 at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova (16-12, 9-8) won four of its last six, and won nine of its last 10 meetings with the Pirates after a 79-67 win on Dec. 16 behind 25 points from Eric Dixon, who leads the country with 22.9 ppg; Seton Hall (7-20, 2-14) is 5-9 at home.

programme.desc: Three-time winner of the tournament Deportivo Saprissa secured a 2-1 victory over Vancouver Whitecaps FC in the first leg matchup at Estadio Ricardo Saprissa Aymá on Feb. 20, as Ariel Rodríguez scored the match-winner in second-half stoppage time.

programme.title: NRL Hits Vegas
programme.desc: The NRL stepped outside of Australia to open its 2024 season under the bright, neon lights of Las Vegas, as the documentary shows all-access footage and interviews with the people that made it happen and the players who got a unique experience.

programme.title: IndyCar Qualifying
programme.desc: Drivers aim for the best starting position for the Firestone Grand Prix, and the fastest time is awarded pole position; Josef Newgarden averaged 108.777 mph last year to win his first pole at St. Petersburg, but would finish the race in 26th.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa (15-13, 6-11) won 11 of the last 12 meetings with the Wildcats after an 80-79 win on Dec. 3 behind 22 points from Josh Dix; Northwestern (15-13, 6-11) is 11-4 at home behind Nick Martinelli, who leads Big Ten scoring with 20.1 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UCLA (20-8, 11-6) won nine of its last 11 games after a 69-61 win over Ohio State beind Eric Dailey Jr.; No. 20 Purdue (19-9, 11-6) lost four-straight games, but is 12-2 at home behind Trey Kaufman-Renn, who leads the team with 19.2 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Nevada (16-12, 8-9) won five of its last seven games, including a 71-65 win over the Rebels on Feb. 1 behind 14 points and six rebounds from Nick Davidson; UNLV (15-13, 9-8) won four of its last five games, and is 10-5 at home this season.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Georgetown claimed a 60-48 victory over Providence in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 18, led by 19 points from Victoria Rivera and Ariel Jenkins' 12 rebounds; Grace Efosa and Nariah Scott both had 10 points for the Friars in the home loss.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Defending champion Paris Saint-Germain, which leads all clubs with 15 titles since the tournament debuted in 1917, defeated Le Mans in the Round of 16, 2-0; Stade Briochin advanced with a 2-1 triumph over Nice at home on Feb. 5.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Georgetown (16-11, 7-9) is 3-7 on the road this season; UConn (18-9, 10-6) is 11-2 at home, and won its last nine meetings with the Hoyas after a 68-60 win on Jan. 11 behind 19 points from Alex Karaban and 15 points from Solo Ball.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: Season begins with 2025 FXR Pro Fish Bassmaster Elite at St. Johns River, with Greg Hackney (who was 2nd at St. Johns in 2016 and 2021), Easton Fothergill, Jeff Gustafson, Jason Williamson, Justin Hammer, Takumi Ito, and Keith Combs among anglers.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Seattle Sounders FC broke a 1-1 tie with two unanswered goals in the second half to beat Guatemalan club Antigua GFC at Estadio Pensativo in the first leg matchup, 3-1, on Feb. 19, as Pedro de la Vega scored the game-winner in the 61st minute.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: FC Cincinnati looks to advance to the Round of 16 after cruising to a 4-1 victory over Honduran side Motagua at Estadio José de la Paz Herrera Uclés in the first leg matchup on Feb. 19, as Pavel Bucha notched a brace with a goal in each half.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Costa Rican side Herediano and MLS club Real Salt Lake played to a scoreless draw at Estadio Nacional de Costa Rica in the first leg matchup on Feb. 19; Real Salt Lake was the runner-up to Monterrey in the 2010-11 edition of the tournament.
